trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Generic SQL Connector
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Generic SQL Connector

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to configure Microsoft's Generic SQL Connector.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to configure Microsoft's Generic SQL Connector.

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL Connector technical reference
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL Connector technical reference

trans-unit.source: This article describes the Generic SQL Connector.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the Generic SQL Connector.

trans-unit.source: The article applies to the following products:
trans-unit.target: The article applies to the following products:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Identity Manager 2016 (MIM2016)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Identity Manager 2016 (MIM2016)

trans-unit.source: Forefront Identity Manager 2010 R2 (FIM2010R2)
trans-unit.target: Forefront Identity Manager 2010 R2 (FIM2010R2)

trans-unit.source: Must use hotfix 4.1.3461.0 or later [KB2870703](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2870703).
trans-unit.target: Must use hotfix 4.1.3461.0 or later [KB2870703](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2870703).

trans-unit.source: For MIM2016 and FIM2010R2 the Connector is available as a download from the [Microsoft Download Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717495).
trans-unit.target: For MIM2016 and FIM2010R2 the Connector is available as a download from the [Microsoft Download Center](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717495).

trans-unit.source: Overview of the Generic SQL Connector
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Generic SQL Connector

trans-unit.source: The Generic SQL Connector enable you to integrate the synchronization service with a database system that offer ODBC connectivity.
trans-unit.target: The Generic SQL Connector enable you to integrate the synchronization service with a database system that offer ODBC connectivity.

trans-unit.source: From a high level perspective, the following features supported by the current release of the connector:
trans-unit.target: From a high level perspective, the following features supported by the current release of the connector:

trans-unit.source: Feature
trans-unit.target: Feature

trans-unit.source: Support
trans-unit.target: Support

trans-unit.source: Connected data source
trans-unit.target: Connected data source

trans-unit.source: The Connector is supported with all 64-bit ODBC drivers.
trans-unit.target: The Connector is supported with all 64-bit ODBC drivers.

trans-unit.source: It has been tested with the following:
trans-unit.target: It has been tested with the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server & SQL Azure
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server & SQL Azure

trans-unit.source: IBM DB2 10.x
trans-unit.target: IBM DB2 10.x

trans-unit.source: IBM DB2 9.x
trans-unit.target: IBM DB2 9.x

trans-unit.source: Oracle 10 & 11g
trans-unit.target: Oracle 10 & 11g

trans-unit.source: MySQL 5.x
trans-unit.target: MySQL 5.x

trans-unit.source: Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Scenarios

trans-unit.source: Object Lifecycle Management
trans-unit.target: Object Lifecycle Management

trans-unit.source: Password Management
trans-unit.target: Password Management

trans-unit.source: Operations
trans-unit.target: Operations

trans-unit.source: Full Import and Delta Import, Export
trans-unit.target: Full Import and Delta Import, Export

trans-unit.source: For Export: Add, Delete, Update, and Replace
trans-unit.target: For Export: Add, Delete, Update, and Replace

trans-unit.source: Set Password, Change Password
trans-unit.target: Set Password, Change Password

trans-unit.source: Schema
trans-unit.target: Schema

trans-unit.source: Dynamic discovery of objects and attributes
trans-unit.target: Dynamic discovery of objects and attributes

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you use the Connector, make sure you have the following on the synchronization server in addition to any hotfix mentioned above:
trans-unit.target: Before you use the Connector, make sure you have the following on the synchronization server in addition to any hotfix mentioned above:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft .NET 4.5.2 Framework or later
trans-unit.target: Microsoft .NET 4.5.2 Framework or later

trans-unit.source: 64-bit ODBC client drivers
trans-unit.target: 64-bit ODBC client drivers

trans-unit.source: Permissions in connected data source
trans-unit.target: Permissions in connected data source

trans-unit.source: To create or perform any of the supported tasks in Generic SQL connector, you must have:
trans-unit.target: To create or perform any of the supported tasks in Generic SQL connector, you must have:

trans-unit.source: db_datareader
trans-unit.target: db_datareader

trans-unit.source: db_datawriter
trans-unit.target: db_datawriter

trans-unit.source: Ports and protocols
trans-unit.target: Ports and protocols

trans-unit.source: For the ports required for the ODBC driver to work, please consult the database vendor's documentation.
trans-unit.target: For the ports required for the ODBC driver to work, please consult the database vendor's documentation.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Connector
trans-unit.target: Create a new Connector

trans-unit.source: To Create a Generic SQL connector, in **Synchronization Service** select **Management Agent** and **Create**.
trans-unit.target: To Create a Generic SQL connector, in **Synchronization Service** select **Management Agent** and **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Generic SQL (Microsoft)** Connector.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Generic SQL (Microsoft)** Connector.

trans-unit.source: CreateConnector
trans-unit.target: CreateConnector

trans-unit.source: Connectivity
trans-unit.target: Connectivity

trans-unit.source: The Connector uses an ODBC DSN file for connectivity.
trans-unit.target: The Connector uses an ODBC DSN file for connectivity.

trans-unit.source: Create the DSN file using **ODBC Data Sources** found in the start menu under **Administrative Tools**.
trans-unit.target: Create the DSN file using **ODBC Data Sources** found in the start menu under **Administrative Tools**.

trans-unit.source: In the administrative tool, create a **File DSN** so it can be provided to the Connector.
trans-unit.target: In the administrative tool, create a **File DSN** so it can be provided to the Connector.

trans-unit.source: CreateConnector
trans-unit.target: CreateConnector

trans-unit.source: The Connectivity screen is the first when you create a new Generic SQL Connector.
trans-unit.target: The Connectivity screen is the first when you create a new Generic SQL Connector.

trans-unit.source: You first need to provide the following information:
trans-unit.target: You first need to provide the following information:

trans-unit.source: DSN file path
trans-unit.target: DSN file path

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: User Name
trans-unit.target: User Name

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: The database should support one of the authentication methods mentioned below.
trans-unit.target: The database should support one of the authentication methods mentioned below.

trans-unit.source: **Windows authentication**: The authenticating database will use the Windows credentials to verify the user.
trans-unit.target: **Windows authentication**: The authenticating database will use the Windows credentials to verify the user.

trans-unit.source: In this case the service account used by the synchronization service will be used.
trans-unit.target: In this case the service account used by the synchronization service will be used.

trans-unit.source: This account will need permissions to the database.
trans-unit.target: This account will need permissions to the database.

trans-unit.source: **SQL authentication**: The authenticating database will use the user name/password defined one the Connectivity screen to connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: **SQL authentication**: The authenticating database will use the user name/password defined one the Connectivity screen to connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: If you store the user name/pasword in the DSN file, the credentials provided on the Connectivity screen has precedence.
trans-unit.target: If you store the user name/pasword in the DSN file, the credentials provided on the Connectivity screen has precedence.

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database authentication**: For more information see [Connect to SQL Database By Using Azure Active Directory Authentication](sql-database-aad-authentication.md)
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database authentication**: For more information see [Connect to SQL Database By Using Azure Active Directory Authentication](sql-database-aad-authentication.md)

trans-unit.source: **DN is Anchor**: If you select this option, the DN will also be used as the anchor attribute.
trans-unit.target: **DN is Anchor**: If you select this option, the DN will also be used as the anchor attribute.

trans-unit.source: It can be used for a simple implementation but also has the following limitations:
trans-unit.target: It can be used for a simple implementation but also has the following limitations:

trans-unit.source: Connector supports only 1 object type.
trans-unit.target: Connector supports only 1 object type.

trans-unit.source: Therefore any reference attributes can only reference the same object type.
trans-unit.target: Therefore any reference attributes can only reference the same object type.

trans-unit.source: **Export Type: Object Replace**: During export when only some attributes have been changed, the entire object with all attributes will be exported and will replace the existing object.
trans-unit.target: **Export Type: Object Replace**: During export when only some attributes have been changed, the entire object with all attributes will be exported and will replace the existing object.

trans-unit.source: Schema 1 (Detect object types)
trans-unit.target: Schema 1 (Detect object types)

trans-unit.source: On this page you are going to configure how the Connector is going to find the different object types in the database.
trans-unit.target: On this page you are going to configure how the Connector is going to find the different object types in the database.

trans-unit.source: Every object type will be presented as a partition and configured further on **Configure Partitions and Hierarchies**.
trans-unit.target: Every object type will be presented as a partition and configured further on **Configure Partitions and Hierarchies**.

trans-unit.source: schema1a
trans-unit.target: schema1a

trans-unit.source: **Object Type detection method**: The Connector supports these object type detection methods.
trans-unit.target: **Object Type detection method**: The Connector supports these object type detection methods.

trans-unit.source: **Fixed Value**: You provide the list of object types with a comma separated list.
trans-unit.target: **Fixed Value**: You provide the list of object types with a comma separated list.

trans-unit.source: E.g.
trans-unit.target: E.g.

trans-unit.source: User,Group,Department.
trans-unit.target: User,Group,Department.

trans-unit.source: ![schema1b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema1b.png)
trans-unit.target: ![schema1b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema1b.png)

trans-unit.source: **Table/View/Stored Procedure**: Provide the name of the table/view/stored procedure and then the column name which will provide the list of object types.
trans-unit.target: **Table/View/Stored Procedure**: Provide the name of the table/view/stored procedure and then the column name which will provide the list of object types.

trans-unit.source: If you use a stored procedure then also provide parameters for it in the format **[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]**.
trans-unit.target: If you use a stored procedure then also provide parameters for it in the format **[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]**.

trans-unit.source: Provide each parameter on a separate line (use Ctrl+Enter to get a new line).
trans-unit.target: Provide each parameter on a separate line (use Ctrl+Enter to get a new line).

trans-unit.source: ![schema1c](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema1c.png)
trans-unit.target: ![schema1c](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema1c.png)

trans-unit.source: **SQL Query**: This option allow you to provide a SQL query which will return a single column with object types, e.g. `SELECT [Column Name] FROM TABLENAME`.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Query**: This option allow you to provide a SQL query which will return a single column with object types, e.g. `SELECT [Column Name] FROM TABLENAME`.

trans-unit.source: The returned column must be of type string (varchar).
trans-unit.target: The returned column must be of type string (varchar).

trans-unit.source: Schema 2 (Detect attribute types)
trans-unit.target: Schema 2 (Detect attribute types)

trans-unit.source: On this page you are going to configure how the attribute names and types are going to be detected.
trans-unit.target: On this page you are going to configure how the attribute names and types are going to be detected.

trans-unit.source: The configuration options are listed for every object type detected on the previous page.
trans-unit.target: The configuration options are listed for every object type detected on the previous page.

trans-unit.source: schema2a
trans-unit.target: schema2a

trans-unit.source: **Attribute Type detection method**: The Connector supports these attribute type detection methods with every detected object type in Schema 1 screen.
trans-unit.target: **Attribute Type detection method**: The Connector supports these attribute type detection methods with every detected object type in Schema 1 screen.

trans-unit.source: **Table/View/Stored Procedure**: Provide the name of the table/view/stored procedure which should be used to find the attribute names.
trans-unit.target: **Table/View/Stored Procedure**: Provide the name of the table/view/stored procedure which should be used to find the attribute names.

trans-unit.source: If you use a stored procedure then also provide parameters for it in the format **[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]**.
trans-unit.target: If you use a stored procedure then also provide parameters for it in the format **[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]**.

trans-unit.source: Provide each parameter on a separate line (use Ctrl+Enter to get a new line).
trans-unit.target: Provide each parameter on a separate line (use Ctrl+Enter to get a new line).

trans-unit.source: To detect the attribute names in a multi-valued attribute, provide a comma separated list of Tables or Views.
trans-unit.target: To detect the attribute names in a multi-valued attribute, provide a comma separated list of Tables or Views.

trans-unit.source: Multivalued scenarios are not supported if parent and child table have same column names.
trans-unit.target: Multivalued scenarios are not supported if parent and child table have same column names.

trans-unit.source: **SQL query** This option allow you to provide a SQL query which will return a single column with attribute names, e.g. `SELECT [Column Name] FROM TABLENAME`.
trans-unit.target: **SQL query** This option allow you to provide a SQL query which will return a single column with attribute names, e.g. `SELECT [Column Name] FROM TABLENAME`.

trans-unit.source: The returned column must be of type string (varchar).
trans-unit.target: The returned column must be of type string (varchar).

trans-unit.source: Schema 3 (Define anchor and DN)
trans-unit.target: Schema 3 (Define anchor and DN)

trans-unit.source: This page allows you to configure anchor and DN attribute for each detected object type.
trans-unit.target: This page allows you to configure anchor and DN attribute for each detected object type.

trans-unit.source: You can select multiple attribute to make the anchor unique.
trans-unit.target: You can select multiple attribute to make the anchor unique.

trans-unit.source: schema3a
trans-unit.target: schema3a

trans-unit.source: Multi-valued and Boolean attributes are not listed.
trans-unit.target: Multi-valued and Boolean attributes are not listed.

trans-unit.source: Same attribute cannot use for DN and anchor, unless **DN is Anchor** is selected on the Connectivity page.
trans-unit.target: Same attribute cannot use for DN and anchor, unless **DN is Anchor** is selected on the Connectivity page.

trans-unit.source: If **DN is Anchor** is selected on the Connectivity page, this page requires only the DN attribute.
trans-unit.target: If **DN is Anchor** is selected on the Connectivity page, this page requires only the DN attribute.

trans-unit.source: This attribute would also be used as the anchor attribute.
trans-unit.target: This attribute would also be used as the anchor attribute.

trans-unit.source: ![schema3b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema3b.png)
trans-unit.target: ![schema3b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema3b.png)

trans-unit.source: Schema 4 (Define attribute type, reference, and direction)
trans-unit.target: Schema 4 (Define attribute type, reference, and direction)

trans-unit.source: This page allows you to configure the attribute type like integer, reference, string, binary, or Boolean and direction for each attribute.
trans-unit.target: This page allows you to configure the attribute type like integer, reference, string, binary, or Boolean and direction for each attribute.

trans-unit.source: All attributes from page **schema 2** are listed including multi-valued attributes.
trans-unit.target: All attributes from page **schema 2** are listed including multi-valued attributes.

trans-unit.source: schema4a
trans-unit.target: schema4a

trans-unit.source: **DataType**: Used to map the attribute type to those known by the sync engine.
trans-unit.target: **DataType**: Used to map the attribute type to those known by the sync engine.

trans-unit.source: The default is to use the same type as detected in the SQL schema, but DateTime and Reference are not easily detactable.
trans-unit.target: The default is to use the same type as detected in the SQL schema, but DateTime and Reference are not easily detactable.

trans-unit.source: For those you need to specify **DateTime** or **Reference**.
trans-unit.target: For those you need to specify **DateTime** or **Reference**.

trans-unit.source: **Direction**: You can set the attribute direction to Import, Export or ImportExport.
trans-unit.target: **Direction**: You can set the attribute direction to Import, Export or ImportExport.

trans-unit.source: ImportExport is default.
trans-unit.target: ImportExport is default.

trans-unit.source: ![schema4b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema4b.png)
trans-unit.target: ![schema4b](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/schema4b.png)

trans-unit.source: Notes:
trans-unit.target: Notes:

trans-unit.source: If an attribute type is not detectable by the Connector, it will use the String data type.
trans-unit.target: If an attribute type is not detectable by the Connector, it will use the String data type.

trans-unit.source: **Nested tables** can be considered one-column database tables.
trans-unit.target: **Nested tables** can be considered one-column database tables.

trans-unit.source: Oracle stores the rows of a nested table in no particular order.
trans-unit.target: Oracle stores the rows of a nested table in no particular order.

trans-unit.source: However, when you retrieve the nested table into a PL/SQL variable, the rows are given consecutive subscripts starting at 1.
trans-unit.target: However, when you retrieve the nested table into a PL/SQL variable, the rows are given consecutive subscripts starting at 1.

trans-unit.source: That gives you array-like access to individual rows.
trans-unit.target: That gives you array-like access to individual rows.

trans-unit.source: **VARRYS** are not supported in the connector.
trans-unit.target: **VARRYS** are not supported in the connector.

trans-unit.source: Schema 5 (Define partition for reference attributes)
trans-unit.target: Schema 5 (Define partition for reference attributes)

trans-unit.source: On this page you will configure for all reference attributes which partition, i.e. object type, an attribute is referring to.
trans-unit.target: On this page you will configure for all reference attributes which partition, i.e. object type, an attribute is referring to.

trans-unit.source: schema5
trans-unit.target: schema5

trans-unit.source: If you use **DN is anchor** then you must use the same object type as the one you are referring from.
trans-unit.target: If you use **DN is anchor** then you must use the same object type as the one you are referring from.

trans-unit.source: You cannot reference another object type.
trans-unit.target: You cannot reference another object type.

trans-unit.source: Global Parameters
trans-unit.target: Global Parameters

trans-unit.source: The Global Parameters page is used to configure Delta Import, Date/Time format, and Password method.
trans-unit.target: The Global Parameters page is used to configure Delta Import, Date/Time format, and Password method.

trans-unit.source: globalparameters1
trans-unit.target: globalparameters1

trans-unit.source: The Generic SQL Connector supports the following methods for Delta Import:
trans-unit.target: The Generic SQL Connector supports the following methods for Delta Import:

trans-unit.source: **Trigger**: See [Generating Delta Views Using Triggers](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc708665.aspx).
trans-unit.target: **Trigger**: See [Generating Delta Views Using Triggers](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc708665.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **Watermark**: This is a generic approach and can be used with any database.
trans-unit.target: **Watermark**: This is a generic approach and can be used with any database.

trans-unit.source: The watermark query is pre-populated based on the database vendor.
trans-unit.target: The watermark query is pre-populated based on the database vendor.

trans-unit.source: A watermark column must be present on every table/view used.
trans-unit.target: A watermark column must be present on every table/view used.

trans-unit.source: This must track inserts and updates to the tables as well as its dependent (multi-valued or child) tables.
trans-unit.target: This must track inserts and updates to the tables as well as its dependent (multi-valued or child) tables.

trans-unit.source: The clocks between Synchronization Service and the database server must be synchronized.
trans-unit.target: The clocks between Synchronization Service and the database server must be synchronized.

trans-unit.source: If not, some entries in the delta import might be omitted.
trans-unit.target: If not, some entries in the delta import might be omitted.

trans-unit.source: Limitation:
trans-unit.target: Limitation:

trans-unit.source: Watermark strategy does not supports deleted objects.
trans-unit.target: Watermark strategy does not supports deleted objects.

trans-unit.source: **Snapshot** (Works only with Microsoft SQL Server) [Generating Delta Views Using Snapshots](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc720640.aspx)
trans-unit.target: **Snapshot** (Works only with Microsoft SQL Server) [Generating Delta Views Using Snapshots](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc720640.aspx)

trans-unit.source: **Change Tracking** (Works only with Microsoft SQL Server) [About Change Tracking](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb933875.aspx)
trans-unit.target: **Change Tracking** (Works only with Microsoft SQL Server) [About Change Tracking](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb933875.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Limitations:
trans-unit.target: Limitations:

trans-unit.source: Anchor & DN attribute must be part of primary key for the selected object in the table.
trans-unit.target: Anchor & DN attribute must be part of primary key for the selected object in the table.

trans-unit.source: SQL query is unsupported during Import and Export with Change Tracking.
trans-unit.target: SQL query is unsupported during Import and Export with Change Tracking.

trans-unit.source: **Additional Parameters**: Specify the Database Server Time Zone indicating where your Database server is located.
trans-unit.target: **Additional Parameters**: Specify the Database Server Time Zone indicating where your Database server is located.

trans-unit.source: This value is used to support the various format of date & time attributes.
trans-unit.target: This value is used to support the various format of date & time attributes.

trans-unit.source: The Connector will always store date and date-time in UTC format.
trans-unit.target: The Connector will always store date and date-time in UTC format.

trans-unit.source: To be able to correctly convert the date and times the time zone of the database server and the format used must be specified.
trans-unit.target: To be able to correctly convert the date and times the time zone of the database server and the format used must be specified.

trans-unit.source: The format should be expressed in .Net format.
trans-unit.target: The format should be expressed in .Net format.

trans-unit.source: During export every date time attribute must be provided to the Connector in UTC time format.
trans-unit.target: During export every date time attribute must be provided to the Connector in UTC time format.

trans-unit.source: globalparameters2
trans-unit.target: globalparameters2

trans-unit.source: **Password Configuration**: The connector provides password synchronization capabilities and supports set and change password.
trans-unit.target: **Password Configuration**: The connector provides password synchronization capabilities and supports set and change password.

trans-unit.source: The Connector provides two methods to support password synchronization:
trans-unit.target: The Connector provides two methods to support password synchronization:

trans-unit.source: **Stored Procedure**: This method required two stored procedures to support Set & Change password.
trans-unit.target: **Stored Procedure**: This method required two stored procedures to support Set & Change password.

trans-unit.source: Type all parameters for add and change the password operation in Set Password SP and Change Password SP Parameters respectively as per below example.
trans-unit.target: Type all parameters for add and change the password operation in Set Password SP and Change Password SP Parameters respectively as per below example.

trans-unit.source: ![globalparameters3](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters3.png)
trans-unit.target: ![globalparameters3](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters3.png)

trans-unit.source: **Password Extension**: This method requires Password extension DLL (you need to provide the Extension DLL Name that is implementing [IMAExtensible2Password](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.metadirectoryservices.imaextensible2password.aspx) interface).
trans-unit.target: **Password Extension**: This method requires Password extension DLL (you need to provide the Extension DLL Name that is implementing [IMAExtensible2Password](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.metadirectoryservices.imaextensible2password.aspx) interface).

trans-unit.source: Password extension assembly must be placed in extension folder so that connector can load the DLL at runtime.
trans-unit.target: Password extension assembly must be placed in extension folder so that connector can load the DLL at runtime.

trans-unit.source: ![globalparameters4](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters4.png)
trans-unit.target: ![globalparameters4](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters4.png)

trans-unit.source: You also have to enable the Password Management on the **Configure Extension** page.
trans-unit.target: You also have to enable the Password Management on the **Configure Extension** page.

trans-unit.source: ![globalparameters5](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters5.png)
trans-unit.target: ![globalparameters5](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/globalparameters5.png)

trans-unit.source: Configure Partitions and Hierarchies
trans-unit.target: Configure Partitions and Hierarchies

trans-unit.source: On the partitions and hierarchies page, select all object types.
trans-unit.target: On the partitions and hierarchies page, select all object types.

trans-unit.source: Each object type is in its own partition.
trans-unit.target: Each object type is in its own partition.

trans-unit.source: partitions1
trans-unit.target: partitions1

trans-unit.source: You can also override the values defined on the **Connectivity** or **Global Parameters** page.
trans-unit.target: You can also override the values defined on the **Connectivity** or **Global Parameters** page.

trans-unit.source: partitions2
trans-unit.target: partitions2

trans-unit.source: Configure Anchors
trans-unit.target: Configure Anchors

trans-unit.source: This page is read-only since the anchor has already been defined.
trans-unit.target: This page is read-only since the anchor has already been defined.

trans-unit.source: The selected anchor attribute is always appended with the object type to ensure it will remain unique across object types.
trans-unit.target: The selected anchor attribute is always appended with the object type to ensure it will remain unique across object types.

trans-unit.source: anchors
trans-unit.target: anchors

trans-unit.source: Configure Run Step Parameter
trans-unit.target: Configure Run Step Parameter

trans-unit.source: These steps are configured on the run profiles on the Connector.
trans-unit.target: These steps are configured on the run profiles on the Connector.

trans-unit.source: These configurations will do the actual work of importing and exporting data.
trans-unit.target: These configurations will do the actual work of importing and exporting data.

trans-unit.source: Full and Delta Import
trans-unit.target: Full and Delta Import

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL Connector support Full and Delta Import using these methods:
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL Connector support Full and Delta Import using these methods:

trans-unit.source: Table
trans-unit.target: Table

trans-unit.source: View
trans-unit.target: View

trans-unit.source: Stored Procedure
trans-unit.target: Stored Procedure

trans-unit.source: SQL Query
trans-unit.target: SQL Query

trans-unit.source: runstep1
trans-unit.target: runstep1

trans-unit.source: Table/View
trans-unit.target: Table/View

trans-unit.source: To import multi-valued attributes for an object, you have to provide the comma separated table/view name in **Name of Multi-Valued table/views** and respective join conditions in the **Join condition** with the parent table.
trans-unit.target: To import multi-valued attributes for an object, you have to provide the comma separated table/view name in **Name of Multi-Valued table/views** and respective join conditions in the **Join condition** with the parent table.

trans-unit.source: Example: You want to import the Employee object and all its multi-valued attributes.
trans-unit.target: Example: You want to import the Employee object and all its multi-valued attributes.

trans-unit.source: There are two tables named Employee (main table) and Department (multi-valued) table.
trans-unit.target: There are two tables named Employee (main table) and Department (multi-valued) table.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: Type **Employee** in **Table/View/SP**.
trans-unit.target: Type **Employee** in **Table/View/SP**.

trans-unit.source: Type Department in **Name of Multi-Valued table/views**.
trans-unit.target: Type Department in **Name of Multi-Valued table/views**.

trans-unit.source: Type the join condition between Employee & Department in **Join Condition**, e.g.
trans-unit.target: Type the join condition between Employee & Department in **Join Condition**, e.g.

trans-unit.source: `Employee.DEPTID=Department.DepartmentID`.
trans-unit.target: `Employee.DEPTID=Department.DepartmentID`.

trans-unit.source: ![runstep2](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/runstep2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![runstep2](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-connector-genericsql/runstep2.png)

trans-unit.source: Stored procedures
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures

trans-unit.source: runstep3
trans-unit.target: runstep3

trans-unit.source: If you have a lot of data it is recommended to implement pagination with your Stored Procedures.
trans-unit.target: If you have a lot of data it is recommended to implement pagination with your Stored Procedures.

trans-unit.source: For your Stored Procedure to support pagination to need to provide Start Index and End Index.
trans-unit.target: For your Stored Procedure to support pagination to need to provide Start Index and End Index.

trans-unit.source: See: [Efficiently Paging Through Large Amounts of Data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb445504.aspx).
trans-unit.target: See: [Efficiently Paging Through Large Amounts of Data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb445504.aspx).

trans-unit.source: @StartIndex and @EndIndex will be replaced at execution time with respective page size value configured on **Configure Step** page.
trans-unit.target: @StartIndex and @EndIndex will be replaced at execution time with respective page size value configured on **Configure Step** page.

trans-unit.source: Example: If connector retrieve first page and the page size is set 500, in such situation @StartIndex would be 1 and @EndIndex considered as 500 and this values, increases as connector retrieve subsequent pages and change the @StartIndex & @EndIndex value.
trans-unit.target: Example: If connector retrieve first page and the page size is set 500, in such situation @StartIndex would be 1 and @EndIndex considered as 500 and this values, increases as connector retrieve subsequent pages and change the @StartIndex & @EndIndex value.

trans-unit.source: To execute parameterized Stored Procedure, provide the parameters in `[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]` format.
trans-unit.target: To execute parameterized Stored Procedure, provide the parameters in `[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]` format.

trans-unit.source: Enter each parameter on a separate line (Use Ctrl + Enter to get a new line).
trans-unit.target: Enter each parameter on a separate line (Use Ctrl + Enter to get a new line).

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL connector also supports Import operation from distributed environment, e.g. Linked Servers in Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL connector also supports Import operation from distributed environment, e.g. Linked Servers in Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In case information is to be retrieved from a Table in Linked server then Table is to be provided in the format: `[ServerName].[Database].[Schema].[TableName]`
trans-unit.target: In case information is to be retrieved from a Table in Linked server then Table is to be provided in the format: `[ServerName].[Database].[Schema].[TableName]`

trans-unit.source: In distributed environments the Connector only supports Microsoft linked server.
trans-unit.target: In distributed environments the Connector only supports Microsoft linked server.

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL Connector supports only those objects that have the similar structure (both alias name and data type) between run steps information and schema detection.
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL Connector supports only those objects that have the similar structure (both alias name and data type) between run steps information and schema detection.

trans-unit.source: If the selected object from schema and provided information at run step is different, then SQL Connector will unable to support this type of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: If the selected object from schema and provided information at run step is different, then SQL Connector will unable to support this type of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: SQL Query
trans-unit.target: SQL Query

trans-unit.source: runstep4
trans-unit.target: runstep4

trans-unit.source: runstep5
trans-unit.target: runstep5

trans-unit.source: Multiple result set queries not supported.
trans-unit.target: Multiple result set queries not supported.

trans-unit.source: SQL query supports the pagination and provide start Index and End Index as a variable to support pagination.
trans-unit.target: SQL query supports the pagination and provide start Index and End Index as a variable to support pagination.

trans-unit.source: Delta Import
trans-unit.target: Delta Import

trans-unit.source: runstep6
trans-unit.target: runstep6

trans-unit.source: Delta Import configuration require some more configuration along with other supported method like in Full Import.
trans-unit.target: Delta Import configuration require some more configuration along with other supported method like in Full Import.

trans-unit.source: If users chooses the Trigger or Snapshot approach to track delta changes, user can provide History Table or Snapshot database in **History Table or Snapshot database name** box.
trans-unit.target: If users chooses the Trigger or Snapshot approach to track delta changes, user can provide History Table or Snapshot database in **History Table or Snapshot database name** box.

trans-unit.source: User also need to provide join condition between History table and Parent table.
trans-unit.target: User also need to provide join condition between History table and Parent table.

trans-unit.source: Example: `Employee.ID=History.EmployeeID`
trans-unit.target: Example: `Employee.ID=History.EmployeeID`

trans-unit.source: Track the transaction on parent table from the history table user must provide column name that contains the operation information like (Add/Update/Delete).
trans-unit.target: Track the transaction on parent table from the history table user must provide column name that contains the operation information like (Add/Update/Delete).

trans-unit.source: If user chooses Watermark to track the delta changes, user must provide the column name that contains the operation information in **Water Mark Column Name**.
trans-unit.target: If user chooses Watermark to track the delta changes, user must provide the column name that contains the operation information in **Water Mark Column Name**.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, connector can consider this column while performing Delta Import.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, connector can consider this column while performing Delta Import.

trans-unit.source: The **change Type attribute** column is required for the change type.
trans-unit.target: The **change Type attribute** column is required for the change type.

trans-unit.source: This column maps a change that occurs in the primary table or multi-value table to a change type in the delta view.
trans-unit.target: This column maps a change that occurs in the primary table or multi-value table to a change type in the delta view.

trans-unit.source: This column can contain the Modify_Attribute change type for attribute-level change or an Add, Modify, or Delete change type for an object-level change type.
trans-unit.target: This column can contain the Modify_Attribute change type for attribute-level change or an Add, Modify, or Delete change type for an object-level change type.

trans-unit.source: If it is something other than the default value Add, Modify, or Delete user can define those values using this option.
trans-unit.target: If it is something other than the default value Add, Modify, or Delete user can define those values using this option.

trans-unit.source: Export
trans-unit.target: Export

trans-unit.source: runstep7
trans-unit.target: runstep7

trans-unit.source: Generic SQL Connector support Export using four supported methods such as:
trans-unit.target: Generic SQL Connector support Export using four supported methods such as:

trans-unit.source: Table
trans-unit.target: Table

trans-unit.source: View
trans-unit.target: View

trans-unit.source: Stored Procedure
trans-unit.target: Stored Procedure

trans-unit.source: SQL Query
trans-unit.target: SQL Query

trans-unit.source: Table/View
trans-unit.target: Table/View

trans-unit.source: If users chooses the Table/View option, than connector will generate the respective queries and perform the Export.
trans-unit.target: If users chooses the Table/View option, than connector will generate the respective queries and perform the Export.

trans-unit.source: Stored procedures
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures

trans-unit.source: runstep8
trans-unit.target: runstep8

trans-unit.source: If users chooses the Stored Procedure option, Export require 3 different Stored procedures to perform various Insert/Update/Delete operation.
trans-unit.target: If users chooses the Stored Procedure option, Export require 3 different Stored procedures to perform various Insert/Update/Delete operation.

trans-unit.source: **Add SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for insertion in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Add SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for insertion in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: **Update SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for update in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Update SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for update in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: **Delete SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for deletion in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Delete SP Name**, This SP execute if any object comes to connector for deletion in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: Attribute selected from the schema used as a parameter value to the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: Attribute selected from the schema used as a parameter value to the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Example: EmployeeName: INPUT: @EmployeeName (EmployeeName is selected in the connector schema and connector replace the respective value while performing export)
trans-unit.target: Example: EmployeeName: INPUT: @EmployeeName (EmployeeName is selected in the connector schema and connector replace the respective value while performing export)

trans-unit.source: Executing parameterized stored procedure type all parameters in `[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]` format.
trans-unit.target: Executing parameterized stored procedure type all parameters in `[Name]:[Direction]:[Value]` format.

trans-unit.source: Enter each parameter on a separate line (Use Ctrl + Enter to get a new line).
trans-unit.target: Enter each parameter on a separate line (Use Ctrl + Enter to get a new line).

trans-unit.source: SQL query
trans-unit.target: SQL query

trans-unit.source: runstep9
trans-unit.target: runstep9

trans-unit.source: If users chooses the SQL query option, Export require 3 different queries to perform various Insert/Update/Delete operations.
trans-unit.target: If users chooses the SQL query option, Export require 3 different queries to perform various Insert/Update/Delete operations.

trans-unit.source: **Insert Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for insertion in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Insert Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for insertion in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: **Update Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for update in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Update Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for update in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: **Delete Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for deletion in the respective table.
trans-unit.target: **Delete Query**: This query execute if any object comes to connector for deletion in the respective table.

trans-unit.source: Attribute selected from the schema used as a parameter value to the query.
trans-unit.target: Attribute selected from the schema used as a parameter value to the query.

trans-unit.source: Example: `Insert into Employee (ID, Name) Values (@ID, @EmployeeName)`
trans-unit.target: Example: `Insert into Employee (ID, Name) Values (@ID, @EmployeeName)`

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: For information on how to enable logging to troubleshoot the connector, see the [How to Enable ETW Tracing for Connectors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=335731).
trans-unit.target: For information on how to enable logging to troubleshoot the connector, see the [How to Enable ETW Tracing for Connectors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=335731).
